newsitem.title: JAPAN: NKK to sell 20 bln yen of land in 1996/97.
newsitem.headline: NKK to sell 20 bln yen of land in 1996/97.

text.p: Steelmaker NKK Corp said on Thursday that it plans to sell some of the land it owns for about 20 billion yen during this fiscal year, which ends next March.
The profit from the sales would be included in NKK's earnings for the year as an extraordinary profit, which affects the company's net earnings but not its current earnings, a company spokesman said.
However, the spokesman declined to provide a fresh forecast for parent net earnings.
The firm said in September that it had lowered its parent current profit for the year to 40 billion yen from its May forecast of 45 billion yen.
Last year, NKK posted a parent current profit of 30.32 billion yen and a net profit of 59.75 billion yen.
NKK sold 43 billion yen worth of land in 1995/96.
